question:
You should spend about 20 minutes on this task.


You and your family are living in rented accommodation in an English-speaking country. You are not satisfied with the condition of some of the furniture.
Write a letter to the landlord. In your letter


introduce yourself
explain what is wrong with the furniture
say what action you would like the landlord to take
Write at least 150 words.




You do NOT need to write any addresses.


Begin your letter as follows:
text: Hello, my name is Rose. In 2022-8-2 I rented your apartment in Chichester street no.31 Block B. I’m so thankful because you gave me and my family  a low price to rent. Thank you! But now there is  a little problem with the furniture, hope we can solve it.

To be honest, there is  good condition for all furniture except the cabinet. There is on the 2nd floor one of the bedrooms. The cabinet was in good condition with vintage style, but when I moved into this home on the first day, it appeared there were a lot of insects. That time I was shocked and plenty of scared  me and my mom. Mr Ben can you please help to fix this problem? For example find the pesticides company. or something a better suggestion for us?

For now I and my family were locking the door in the bedroom, and we didn't  get into it, just  for  waiting the next step to fix this problem. Mr Ben, if you see this letter, can you send me a response? Or you can call me by phone anytime, my phone no. is : 9033576904.
Thank you very much and I appreciate  your assistance.

error_list.error_des: When speaking directly to people, their names must be set off by commas. Consider adding the comma(s).
It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase For example. Consider adding a comma.
It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase For now. Consider adding a comma.
The phrase following the intransitive verb waiting seems to be missing a preposition. Consider adding one.
